Posts.Content: turtle42 wrote: I had a double mastectomy last June with lat flap on previous radiated side. Things have settled down a lot and all swelling is gone. What I am concerned about is it looks like my implant came loose from the middle of my chest and is migrating towards the outer side. There is definitely a large empty space in the center of my chest. If this happened would I feel it let loose? I don't remember anything happinging but I do run on a treadmill and I'm pretty active. I don't see my plastic surgeon until September and I'm quite concerned about this. Thanks for any advice. Posts.Title: Almost one year post mastectomy question turtle42 Kicks

Posts.Content: turtle42 wrote: I am alittle over 2 years out of the last rads treatment. I just got a letter in the mail that says it is time to schedule an appointment with the rads onc. How many of you still see the rads onc this far out? I see the med onc every 6 months. I really like the exam from the rads onc( he is very thorough), but I dont know if this is a good enough reason to go. Any thoughts? Posts.Title: 2 years out--- do I need to see the rad onc? turtle42 ginger2345

Posts.Content: Feb 22, 2009 10:00AM turtle42 wrote: I was 40 at the time. Had 2 previous mammos that showed nothing. Felt a lump and had a biopsy that came back benign. Two months later got a call from the center that did the biopsy saying that I needed to come back because they may have missed the lump. The doctor couldn't feel the lump, I had to put his finger on it. Did an ultrasound biopsy and he was saying that we would have a good laugh about it later when it came back benign as he was so sure it would. Needless to say we never had that laugh.
Posts.Title: Poll - How old were you when dx with BC Times3 Minetta57

Posts.Content: turtle42 wrote: I had a double mastectomy with lat flap on left previously radiated side this past Monday (june 23rd).I see a lot if women on here who are told to start arm exercises right after surgery. My surgeon has me on very limited use of my arms until next Tuesday. I am so worried this is too long and I will suffer in the long run. I was just wondering if anyone else was told to hold off with the arm exercises for a week. Posts.Content: Jul 8, 2014 08:40PM turtle42 wrote: Hi Keri, I saw that you responded to my other post. Thanks for the reply. It's nice to talk with someone on the same path as I am. I saw my surgeon today and she still wants limited use of arms. After my fill today I don't really want to use them due to pain so I guess that's a good thing.  Hope you are doing well, Jackie
Posts.Title: Questions regarding lat flap mastectomy this past Monday turtle42 kfinnigan

Posts.Content: Jul 9, 2014 08:21AM turtle42 wrote: Hi Purplegurll. I didn't get a fill at my first follow up either because of the swelling. Just got the drain out if my right side yesterday and I'm so happy to have one side with no drains. I still feel really bruised and the te make it really painful for me to have my arms down at my sides.  Hope your recovery goes smooth. Jackie

Posts.Content: Dec 1, 2016 11:27AM turtle42 wrote: Thanks for your honesty debiann. Definitely not the answer I was hoping for.It just seems crazy that the hot flashes are actually worse now. I have all the other issues you mentioned too. The joint pain is a lot better now that Arimidex is out of my system.
Posts.Title: Done wih Arimidex and still hot flashing turtle42 turtle42

Posts.Content: turtle42 wrote: My initial diagnosis was in August of 2006. Had 2 lumpectomies, radiation, complete hysterectomy and so far 7 years on anti hormonals. During that time I have had numerous biopsies and thank goodness all have come back good. I've been told that mammograms aren't very good at finding rumors in me due to dense breasts and there are many spots of concern. This is why I am choosing to due a double mastectomy.  I'm just looking for any advise. I will have a latissimus on the radiated side with reconstruction on both sides. Is there still a chance of complications with the radiated side this long after treatment? I'm having a really hard time with this. My surgery is scheduled for the middle of June ( I have the summer off from work). I want to have it done for piece of mind but I keep having second thoughts. Posts.Title: Almost 8 years out and now mastectomy turtle42 dlb823

Posts.Content: Nov 9, 2009 07:03PM turtle42 wrote: What a great thread. I am another stage 1 here and three years out, tho I dont post much. I get a TM check every six months and also a chest x-ray. Does anyone else get a regular chest x-ray? I just had a 6 month follow up and was so nervous for about a week before. Had a great check up and everything is fine for now. Mammo coming up in January, just glad its after Christmas. Jackie
Posts.Title: CALLING ALL STAGE I SISTERS sheila888 MCBaker

Posts.Content: turtle42 wrote: Finished up 30 days ago after completing five years on Tamoxifen and another five on Arimidex. I have been having hot flashes for ten years. Up to 20 plus a day and night sweats too. I was hoping to have these go away or at least lessen but they seem to be worse now. I had a total hysterectomy at 40 and I'm sure that plays a part but 10 years is long enough. Please tell me they will go away soon.
